pli-tv-bi-vb-pc8:0.2_0: The account of the nun Analysis
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc8:0.3_0: The chapter on offenses entailing confession
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc8:0.5_0: The training rule on disposing of feces
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc8:1.11_0: “Sir, why are you entering the nuns’ dwelling place with a firebrand?”
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc8:1.12_0: “These shaven-headed sluts threw the contents of a feces-pot on my head.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc8:1.13_0: I’ll expel them to see the victor.”
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc8:1.15_0: You’ll get your wages and a thousand coins in addition.”
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc8:1.16_0: That brahmin then washed his head, went to the king’s residence, and he got his wages and a thousand coins in addition.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc8:1.17_0: But that lay follower returned to the nuns’ dwelling place, told them what had happened, and then scolded them.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc8:1.18_0: The nuns of few desires complained and criticized Thullanandā,
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc8:1.19_0: “How can nuns dispose of feces over a wall?” ...
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc8:1.1_0: At one time when the Buddha was staying at Sāvatthī in the Anāthapiṇḍika’s Monastery,
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc8:1.20_0: “Is it true, monks, that nuns do this?”
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc8:1.23_0: “How can nuns dispose of feces over a wall?
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc8:1.24_0: This won’t give rise to confidence in those without it ...” ...
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc8:1.25_0: the Buddha said, “And, monks, the nuns should recite this training rule like this:
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc8:1.26.1_0: ‘If a nun disposes of feces or urine or trash or food scraps over a wall or over an encircling wall, or she has it disposed of in this way, she commits an offense entailing confession.’”
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc8:1.2_0: a brahmin who had earned money by working for the king thought, “I’ll ask for my wages.” After washing his head, he walked past the nuns’ dwelling place on his way to the king’s residence.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc8:1.3_0: Just then, after defecating in a pot, a nun disposed of the feces over a wall, and it landed on the head of that brahmin.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc8:1.4_0: The brahmin complained and criticized them,
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc8:1.5_0: “They are not ascetics these shaven-headed sluts.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc8:1.6_0: How can they throw the contents of a feces-pot on my head?
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc8:1.7_0: I’ll expel them to see the victor.”
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc8:1.8_0: And he got hold of a firebrand and entered their dwelling place.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc8:1.9_0: Just then a lay follower who was coming out from the nuns’ dwelling place saw that brahmin with a firebrand on his way in,
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc8:2.1.10_0: one that is what is meant.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc8:2.1.12_0: And bones, dirty mouth-rinstocrats or bones.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc8:2.1.14_0: there are three kinds of walls: walls made of bricks, walls made of stone, walls made of wood.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc8:2.1.16_0: there are three kinds of encircling walls: encircling walls made of bricks, encircling walls made of stone, encircling walls made of wood.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc8:2.1.18_0: to the other side of the wall.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc8:2.1.20_0: to the other side of the encircling wall.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc8:2.1.22_0: if she disposes of it himself, she commits an offense entailing confession.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc8:2.1.24_0: if he asks another, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc8:2.1.25_0: If she only asks once, then even if the other throws a lot, she commits one offense entailing confession.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc8:2.1.4_0: ... The nun who has been given the full ordination in unanimity by both Sanghas through a legal procedure consisting of one motion and three announcements that is irreversible and fit to stand—this sort of nun is meant in this case.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc8:2.1.8_0: what is meant is that she has thought.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc8:2.2.2_0: if she disposes of it at a place where no-one passes by;
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc8:2.2.3_0: if she disposes of it at a place where no-one passes by;
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc8:2.2.5_0: if she is the first offender.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc8:2.2.6_0: The eighth rule, the training rule on weavers, is finished.
